greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Ludic ladder sequence: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} (-1)^LudicPi(k), where LudicPi(n) = A192512(n)-1 gives the number of Ludic numbers > 1 and <= n.
comment: This is an analogous sequence to A065358, but involving Ludic numbers (A003309) instead of primes. Compare the scatter-plots.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences generated by sieves
xref: Differs from A065358 for the first time at n=19, where a(19) = 3, while A065358(19) = 5.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 22 2018
